div.p: The grace of God be with us all, which I indeed need, in which I place my comfort, help, and faith; as He wills to deal with me. For my leg is completely stiff; the cold pain takes hold with great distress, so that I can no longer walk or stand on my legs. The helper does his best honestly (I will repay it). I have not been able to go to church for 4 weeks, and still cannot.

Further, I have asked Josua, also cousin Heinrich, that they come to me as soon as they can; for I need Heinrich's advice. I want to make an agreement with my son; for in the morning such great fainting spells come (especially yesterday), that I fear they might take me away once and for all.

Therefore, I do not want to burden you with my present condition, for the sake of brotherly loyalty and love towards God and man, everything is well; the more so. If He wills, it is my goal. When I am better, I will write to you more. God be with you all; may He protect you, keep you in true faith for salvation. Amen. Let it be.
To his faithful, dear brother Mr. Heinrich Bullinger in Zurich.
The last letter from my brother without one, written in July 1570.
